Piece Class¶

class api.piece.piece_interface.Color(value)¶

An enumeration.

class api.piece.piece_interface.PieceInterface(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Interface that a piece should implement

get_checked_moves() → dict¶
Returns

a dictionary. Key is “moves”, and value is a list of all available moves that will not

make the same side king being checked after the move.

get_color() → api.piece.piece_interface.Color¶
Returns

the color of piece, Color.WHITE, Color.BLACK or Color.Empty.

get_moves() → list¶

This function will be implemented in each piece class.

static is_valid_coord(row: int, col: int) → bool¶

Check if a Coordinate(row, col) is valid. :param row: the index of rows of the board :param col: the index of columns of the board :return: True if row and col are all equal to or greater than 0 and less than 8. Otherwise, False.

to_string() → str¶

This function will be implemented in each piece class.

class api.piece.empty.Empty(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Empty Piece

get_moves() → list¶

This is empty piece meaning at this square there is no pieces and no moves. :return: empty list meaning no moves

to_string() → str¶

For debugging use, simply print * :return: a string “*”

class api.piece.bishop.Bishop(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Piece Bishop

get_moves() → list¶
Returns

a list of all available moves of the piece in order

by directions (upper right, lower right, upper left, lower left).

to_string() → str¶
Returns

“B” if the color of the piece is Color.WHITE. Otherwise, “b”.

class api.piece.pawn.Pawn(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Piece Pawn

en_passant(attack_col: int, row: int, col: int) → bool¶

Check if en passant is available for the capturing pawn at Coordinate(row, col) and the captured pawn at Coordinate(row, attack_col) En passant only occurred immediately after a pawn makes a move of two squares from its starting square, and it could have been captured by an enemy pawn had it advanced only one square. :param attack_col: the col of captured pawn :param row: the row of the capturing pawn ( same as the row of captured pawn) :param col: the col of the capturing pawn :return: True if en passant is available. Otherwise, False.

get_moves() → list¶
Returns

a list of all available moves and captures of a pawn.

to_string() → str¶
Returns

“K” if the color of the piece is Color.WHITE. Otherwise, “k”.

class api.piece.knight.Knight(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Piece Knight

get_moves() → list¶
Returns

a list of all available moves of the piece in order

by directions (clockwise).

to_string() → str¶
Returns

“N” if the color of the piece is Color.WHITE. Otherwise, “n”.

class api.piece.king.King(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Piece King

castling(king_side=True) → bool¶

Castling is available if the following conditions are all met: 1. The king is not being checked. 2. The king and the rook have not been moved. 3. There is no pieces between the king and the rook. 4. The king will not be into check.

Parameters

king_side – True if castling with the rook at king side. Otherwise, False. The default value is False.

Returns

True if castling available. Otherwise, False.

get_checked_moves() → dict¶
Returns

a dictionary. Key is “moves”, and value is a list of all available moves that will not

make the king being checked after the move.

get_moves() → list¶
Returns

a list of all available moves of the piece in order

by directions (up, upper right, right, lower right, down, lower left, left, upper left).

into_checked(king_side: bool) → bool¶

Check if the king will be into check. :param king_side: True if castling with the rook at king side. Otherwise, False. :return: True if the king will be into check. Otherwise, False.

pieces_between_king_and_rook(king_side: bool) → bool¶

Check if there is any piece between the king and the rook.

Parameters

king_side – True if castling with the rook at king side. Otherwise, False.

Returns

True if there a piece between the king and the rook. Otherwise, False.

rook_has_moved(king_side: bool) → bool¶

Check if the rook has been moved. :param king_side: True if castling with the rook at king side. Otherwise, False. :return: True if the rook has been moved. Otherwise, False.

to_string() → str¶
Returns

“K” if the color of the piece is Color.WHITE. Otherwise, “k”.

class api.piece.queen.Queen(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Piece Queen

get_moves() → list¶
Returns

a list of all available moves of the piece in order

by directions (up, upper right, right, lower right, down, lower left, left, upper left).

to_string() → str¶
Returns

“Q” if the color of the piece is Color.WHITE. Otherwise, “q”.

class api.piece.rook.Rook(game: ChessGame, color: api.piece.piece_interface.Color)¶

Piece Rook

get_moves() → list¶
Returns

a list of all available moves of the piece in order

by directions (up, right, down, left).

to_string() → str¶
Returns

“R” if the color of the piece is Color.WHITE. Otherwise, “r”.

class api.piece.coordinate.Coordinate(x: int, y: int)¶

Represents the location of pieces on board

static decode(pos: str) → api.piece.coordinate.Coordinate¶

Decode str coordinates into tuple of integer coordinates Decode ‘a1’ -> (0,0) :param pos: a str representing a coordinate of board :return: an object of Coordinate representing the str coordinates

encode() → str¶

The columns are ‘a’, ‘b’, ‘c’, ‘d’, ‘e’, ‘f’, ‘g’, ‘h’ The rows are ‘1’, ‘2’, ‘3’, ‘4’, ‘5’, ‘6’, ‘7’, ‘8’ An example: Coordinate(0,0) is the bottom left corner of the board. After encoding, it becomes ‘a1’. :return: coordinate of a square in string type

static encode_list(lst: [Coordinate]) → [<class ‘str’>]¶

Encode a list of objects of Coordinates into a list of str coordinates Encode [Coordinate(0,0), Coordinate(7,7)] -> [‘a1’, ‘h8’] :param lst: a list of objects of Coordinates :return: a list of str coordinates

get_tuple() -> (<class 'int'>, <class 'int'>)¶
Returns

a tuple of integer x and y
